gr.interamerican.bo2.arch
Interface DetachStrategy

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractHibernateDetachStrategy, HibernateDetachStrategy, HibernateReadOnlyDetachStrategy, JdbcDetachStrategy
public interface DetachStrategy
extends Serializable

DetachStrategy is a common interface for strategy objects that undertake the management of detached objects.

Method Summary
 void detach(Object object, Provider provider)
          Detaches the object.
 void markExplicitSave(Object object, Provider provider)
          Marks the object as excluded from accidental saves due to any automation of the underlying persistence technology.
 void reattach(Object object, Provider provider)
          Re-attaches an object.
 void reattachForUpdate(Object object, Provider provider)
          Reattach that will not detach transient objects attached by cascade.
 

Method Detail

reattach

void reattach(Object object,
              Provider provider)
Re-attaches an object.

For environments with managed entities, such as ORM implementations, the semantics of this are as follows:

  • Re-attaching a detached object includes the re-attaching of referenced (i.e. not owned) detached entities and collections of detached entities, as well as of the object itself. These referenced detached entities are re-attached as read-only, if this is supported. Transient entities are not attached to the session and are manually detached in case they were attached by side-effect (because of the existence of cascade options).

  • Re-attaching a transient entities is not supported. Transient entities should become managed by a normal store(object) call or by updating a managed entity to which they belong. The algorithm that assesses whether an entity is detached or transient may leverage the existence of an optimistic locking version or timestamp existence.

  • Owned entities and collections of entities are assumed to have appropriate cascade options enabled that re-attach them automatically once their owner is re-attached.

  • The algorithm that distinguishes owned and referenced entities may leverage the existence of Child annotations for owned entity associations.

    Parameters:
    object - Object to re-attach.
    provider - Provider
    See Also:
    ModificationRecord, PersistentObject, Child

    • reattachForUpdate

    void reattachForUpdate(Object object,
                       Provider provider)
    Reattach that will not detach transient objects attached by cascade. In the unit of work that this is called, it is mandatory to perform a database update.

    Parameters:
    object -
    provider -
    See Also:
    reattach(Object, Provider)

    detach

    void detach(Object object,
            Provider provider)
    Detaches the object.

    For environments with managed entities, such as ORM implementations, the semantics of this are as follows:

  • A previous call to reattach(Object, Provider) or reattachForUpdate(Object, Provider) has been performed.

  • Side-effects of this call on the object are reset here.

  • The goal is to leave the state of the object as if no reattach call was performed.

    Parameters:
    object - Object to detach.
    provider - Provider.

    • markExplicitSave

    void markExplicitSave(Object object,
                      Provider provider)
    Marks the object as excluded from accidental saves due to any automation of the underlying persistence technology.

    Parameters:
    object - Object to mark.
    provider - Provider.
